trans-unit.source: Represents a claim for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify when the subject was authenticated.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements, which are represented by the SamlStatement class.

The SAML specification defines the following statement types: - <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement> - <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> - <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> - <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement"></xref> class.
Creates an authorization policy for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Use the CreatePolicy method to get an authorization policy for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> that represents the issuer of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator"></xref> to authenticate the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.

An <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy"></xref> that represents an authorization policy for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.

Classes that derive from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement> class, should set the IsReadOnly property to `true` when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
When overridden in a derived class, reads the SAML statement from the specified XML reader.
Use the ReadXml method to read in a SAML statement, validate the XML, and set the appropriate properties that correspond to the attributes and elements.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the SAML statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
Writes the SAML statement into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the SAML statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
